intro: Chomelia pallidula, commonly known as the pale chomelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Chomelia pallidula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
